item.title: Getting started with zend-framework2
item.description: A simple Hello World # In your command line, get in the directory you want to create the project in, then type: composer create-project zendframework/skeleton-application helloWorldTest. During installation, you will be asked if you want a minimal install: Let’s say yes for the moment, we are just testing. For simplicity sake, we will use the built-in PHP CLI server. From the command line, get yourself in the root directory of your project (helloWorldTest), then run : php -S 0.

item.title: Introduction to Zend Expressive
item.description: A simple Hello World # Using composer, execute the following command in the directory in which the application will be installed: composer create-project zendframework/zend-expressive-skeleton expressive-skeleton. During installation process, you will be asked to make various decisions. For the default installation question, say no (n); For the router, let’s use Aura Router (#1); For the container, let’s use Zend ServiceManager (#3); For the template, let’s use Zend View (#3); Finally, for the error handler, let’s use Whoops (#1).

item.title: Installation
item.description: installing via composer (github) # 1 cd my/project/dir 2 git clone git://github.com/zendframework/ZendSkeletonApplication.git 3 cd ZendSkeletonApplication 4 php composer.phar self-update 5 php composer.phar install
